intro: Terminalia richii, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and alternate, simple leaves. Terminalia richii is often found in moist forests and along riverbanks, where it plays an important role in local ecosystems.
